item.title: the texas tribune: an early tussle over abortion
item.description: a parliamentary point of order about an abortion bill in the texas house was the first tussle of the current legislative session, with both sides sizing up the competition.

item.title: breakthrough and some bad blood at darlington
item.description: regan smith moved in front on a caution nine laps from the end and survived a green-white-checker finish to win the southern 500 for his first sprint cup victory saturday night.

item.title: al jazeera: reporter freed after vanishing in syria
item.description: an al jazeera journalist who went missing in syria three weeks ago has been released after she was apparently detained and sent to iran, the qatar-based television channel said on wednesday.

item.title: inquiring minds on governors island
item.description: at the world science festival 'science on site' event, the island was turned into a classroom and laboratory.

item.title: four foreign journalists held in libya
item.description: globalpost, an online news publication, said the whereabouts of four journalists captured this week by forces loyal to col. muammar el-qaddafi were unknown.

item.title: arizona set to execute convicted killer
item.description: a man who shot dead two convenience store workers in a robbery in 1989 is due to be executed by lethal injection on tuesday, the first prisoner to be put to death by arizona this year.

item.title: sammy ofer, magnate and israeli power broker, dies at 89
item.description: an israeli international shipping magnate, mr. ofer's journey from rags to riches is tainted with scandal and intrigue.

item.title: no resolution in charlie sheen's custody hearing
item.description: former two and a half men star is seeking custody of his twin sons with estranged wife brooke mueller.

item.title: puma raises target after u.s. drives record q1 sales
item.description: puma said it aims to reach the 3 billion euro ($4.36 billion) sales mark this year, earlier than expected, as it reported record first quarter sales driven by growth in the united states.

item.title: playbook ready to contest crowded tablet market
item.description: it's official: with the launch of research in motion's playbook tablet now just a month away, the blackberry maker's battle against apple and google is at the cusp of a fierce new phase.

item.title: two inmates badly stabbed in california prison riot
item.description: corrections officers firing pepper spray and plastic rounds quelled a "large-scale riot" by about 150 inmates on friday at the maximum-security california state prison-sacramento, prison officials said.

item.description: getting comfortable with sitting in the planetary driver's seat.

item.description: imf chief dominique strauss-kahn was placed under a suicide watch in jail, while pressure mounted on him to resign tuesday.

item.title: india reports an increase in wild tiger population
item.description: a new nationwide survey found about 20 percent more tigers living in the wild now than five years ago.

item.title: body of american recovered weeks after japan tsunami
item.description: the body of an anchorage teacher who went missing in japan following the earthquake and tsunami in march has been found more than three weeks later, a family spokeswoman said on wednesday.

item.description: the italian interior minister questioned the utility of the european union monday following a disagreement over how to handle an influx of immigrants from north africa.

item.description: with the april 18 tax-filing deadline less than a week away, filing for an extension may provide a way to avoid last-minute mistakes.

item.title: questions over earlier incident raised in girl's murder

item.title: south sudan accuses bashir of plot, suspends talks
